oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Nashville Record Review Artist Interviews 1982 - C
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recordings of phone interviews with various artists hosted by Al Rosen. Recording features: Mel Tillis, Teddy Gentry, Parker Milsap, George Strait, Ricky Skaggs, Don Williams, and the Flying Burrito Brothers. Item is listed as part C of the 1982 Nashville Radio Review artist interviews.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Al Risen; Skip Woolwine
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Al Risen introduces Mel Tillis, and Tillis reflects on his extended touring -- (02:03) Tillis tells about how he received "The One That Got Away" via the mail -- (02:55) Risen radio spot introduction of "The One That Got Away" -- (02:59) Skip Woolwine greets Teddy Gentry, and Gentry discusses his upcoming tour starting in Baltimore, Maryland -- (03:27) Woolwine and Gentry discuss the difficulty Alabama might have when addressing free time -- (04:48) Gentry reflects on the music they chose for the Mountain Music album; additionally, Woolwine and Gentry discuss how "Mountain Music" was written -- (05:54) Woolwine radio spot introduction of "Mountain Music" -- (06:00) Risen introduces Ronnie Milsap, and Milsap addresses where he had been touring to this point -- (07:31) Risen and Milsap discuss the influence of originality in Milsap's live shows -- (08:26) Milsap and Risen discuss "Any Day Now" -- (09:45) Risen radio spot introducing "Any Day Now" -- (09:49) Risen introduces George Strait, and both address how Strait became a country music artist -- (11:43) Strait describes performing "Fool Hearted Memory" for a movie -- (12:16) Risen inquires about Strait's desire to teach -- (13:15) Risen radio spot introducing "Fool Hearted Memory" -- (13:21) Risen introduces Ricky Skaggs, and both discuss Skaggs becoming a member of the Grand Ole Opry -- (14:48) Skaggs and Risen address Skaggs' family, and "Cryin Over You" is praised -- (15:42) Skaggs reflects on being his own producer -- (16:12) The release of Highways and Heartaches is discussed -- (16:49) Skaggs addresses how he was presented a number of Webb Pierce songs when he chose "I Don't Care" -- (17:38) Risen radio spot introduction of "I Don't Care" -- (17:44) Risen introduces Don Williams who describes his working career and home -- (18:24) Risen and Williams discuss William's European tour -- (19:30) Risen and Williams reflect on Danny Flowers and the Scratch Band -- (20:50) "Listen to the Radio" is revealed to have been sent to Williams via the mail -- (21:34) Risen radio spot introducing "Listen to the Radio" -- (21:41) Risen introduces Milsap, and both address the success of "Any Day Now" -- (22:23) Risen has Milsap reflect on the feeling of having successful albums -- (23:07) Milsap reveals that he is about to begin a new tour -- (23:57) Risen praises "Carolina Dreams," and Milsap reveals it's a reflection of his hometown -- (25:41) Risen and Milsap discuss the loose nature associated with "Any Day Now" -- (26:39) Risen radio spot introducing "Any Day Now" -- (26:44) Risen introduces the Flying Burrito Brothers , and Gib Buillbeau describes how he first started working with John Beland -- (27:55) Risen has Beland describe the hectic schedule the band has faced -- (28:38) Beland and Buillbeau describe their contribution to getting Lefty Frizzell into the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum -- (29:47) "Drinkin' Canada Dry" is described as a fun song -- (30:59) Risen radio spot introducing "Drinkin' Canada Dry"
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Risen, Al; Woolwine, Skip; Tillis, Mel; Gentry, Teddy; Milsap, Ronnie; Milsap, Ronnie, 1943-; Strait, George, 1952-; Skaggs, Ricky; Williams, Don, 1939-; Williams, Don, 1939-2017; Flying Burrito Bros.;
